sql_injection.name: SQL Injection
sql_injection.description: An attacker can execute malicious SQL statements that control a web application's database.
solutions: Apply the principle of least privilege for database accounts
mitigation_steps: Immediately audit and clean the database
Update all database management systems to the latest version

ddos.name: DDoS Attack
ddos.description: Distributed Denial of Service attack that overwhelms the target with traffic from multiple sources.
solutions: Enable DDoS protection services (e.g., Cloudflare, AWS Shield)
mitigation_steps: Contact your ISP or hosting provider

bruteforce.name: Brute Force Attack
bruteforce.description: An attacker attempts to gain access by systematically trying all possible passwords.
solutions: Monitor and alert on multiple failed login attempts
mitigation_steps: Audit user accounts for suspicious activities

xss.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
xss.description: An attacker injects malicious scripts into content from otherwise trusted websites.
solutions: Validate and sanitize all user inputs
Use HTTP-only cookies for sensitive data

port_scan.name: Port Scanning
port_scan.description: An attacker is scanning your network to identify open ports and services.
solutions: Use a firewall to block unnecessary ports
Regularly update and patch all services
Use port knocking for sensitive services
Monitor and log all port scan attempts
